meanings.definition: A type of wire used for fencing.
meanings.sent1: The farmer repaired the fencewire to keep the animals safe.
meanings.sent2: The fencewire was strong and kept the cows from wandering off.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to chew on the fencewire but got a shock instead.
meanings.sent4: The fencewire stretched across the field like a silver ribbon of protection.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the fencewire in the sunlight reminded him of his childhood home.

meanings.definition: To enclose or protect with fencewire.
meanings.sent1: He decided to fencewire the garden to keep out the rabbits.
meanings.sent2: The farmer fencewired the entire property to secure his livestock.
meanings.sent3: She playfully fencewired her brother into a pretend jail using a jump rope.
meanings.sent4: The love in their family fencewired them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The idea of fencewiring their hearts against pain seemed impossible but necessary.
